<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Mass of a block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class implements a sort of fixed-point fraction always between 0 and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1.0.  getMass() == std::numeric&#95;limits&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;::max() indicates a value of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1.0.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Masses can be added and subtracted.  Simple saturation arithmetic is used,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">/// so arithmetic operations never overflow or underflow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Masses can be multiplied.  Multiplication treats full mass as 1 and uses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// an inexpensive floating-point algorithm that&#39;s off-by-one (almost, but not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">/// quite, maximum precision).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Masses can be scaled by \\a BranchProbability at maximum precision.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t Mass = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Adds another mass, saturating at \\a isFull() rather than overflowing.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#ae147ad20e63a91b33aff8585bbe37a9f"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#ae147ad20e63a91b33aff8585bbe37a9f">operator+=</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bfi-detail/blockmass/#adfdb00b2c71ac98e68da9a48c4e4f016">BlockMass</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">    Mass = Sum &lt; Mass ? std::numeric&#95;limits&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;::max() : Sum;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Base class for BlockFrequencyInfoImpl</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase has supporting data structures and some</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="comment">/// algorithms for BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase.  Only algorithms that depend on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the block type (or that call such algorithms) are skipped here.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Nevertheless, the majority of the overall algorithm documentation lives with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BlockFrequencyInfoImpl.  See there for details.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase">BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Resolve a node to its representative.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Get the node currently representing Node, which could be a containing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This function should only be called when distributing mass.  As long as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// there are no irreducible edges to Node, then it will have complexity</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// O(1) in this context.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// In general, the complexity is O(L), where L is the number of loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// headers Node has been packaged into.  Since this method is called in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// the context of distributing mass, L will be the number of loop headers</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// an early exit edge jumps out of.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Unscaled probability weight.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Probability weight for an edge in the graph (including the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// successor/target node).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// All edges in the original function are 32-bit.  However, exit edges from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop packages are taken from 64-bit exit masses, so we need 64-bits of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// space in general.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In addition to the raw weight amount, Weight stores the type of the edge</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in the current context (i.e., the context of the loop being processed).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Is this a local edge within the loop, an exit from the loop, or a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// backedge to the loop header?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Get the name of a MachineBasicBlock.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Get the name of a MachineBasicBlock.  It&#39;s templated so that including from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><Highlight kind="comment">/// CodeGen is unnecessary (that would be a layering issue).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is used mainly for debug output.  The name is similar to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MachineBasicBlock::getFullName(), but skips the name of the function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/bfi-detail/#a01e9ac225b83bb4ded4adbba7d360cbe"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BlockT&gt; std::string <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/bfi-detail/#a01e9ac225b83bb4ded4adbba7d360cbe">getBlockName</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BlockT &#42;BB) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(BB &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Unexpected nullptr&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MachineName = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;BB&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> + <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a>(BB-&gt;getNumber());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BB-&gt;getBasicBlock())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MachineName + </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#91;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> + BB-&gt;getName() + </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#93;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">).str();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MachineName.str();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Graph of irreducible control flow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This graph is used for determining the SCCs in a loop (or top-level</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function) that has irreducible control flow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><Highlight kind="comment">/// During the block frequency algorithm, the local graphs are defined in a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><Highlight kind="comment">/// light-weight way, deferring to the \\a BasicBlock or \\a MachineBasicBlock</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><Highlight kind="comment">/// graphs for most edges, but getting others from \\a LoopData::ExitMap.  The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><Highlight kind="comment">/// latter only has successor information.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\a IrreducibleGraph makes this graph explicit.  It&#39;s in a form that can use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\a GraphTraits (so that \\a analyzeIrreducible() can use \\a scc&#95;iterator),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and it explicitly lists predecessors and successors.  The initialization</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="comment">/// that relies on \\c MachineBasicBlock is defined in the header.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a1147f0ef1ac705077e24462022b4ae1e">IrreducibleGraph</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a281c4629c5f31af3afd60c42fbd93f6b"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a281c4629c5f31af3afd60c42fbd93f6b">BFIBase</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase">BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#add4c9ca63093a8270248e72b08c5302e">addNodesInLoop</a>(&#42;OuterLoop);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a> : OuterLoop-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/loopdata/#aa694a8c0f8d2a04ac086fc4217615367">Nodes</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a2d4ad30cd1d596501e3d99462d1af74e">addEdges</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>, OuterLoop, addBlockEdges);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a2d4ad30cd1d596501e3d99462d1af74e"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a2d4ad30cd1d596501e3d99462d1af74e">IrreducibleGraph::addEdges</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a4f2854e822f1b323869fb6c7ae6fc0d0">BlockNode</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;Working = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph/#a3b13aeab236aa95632c9ef9052c14926">BFI</a>.Working&#91;<a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>.Index&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> : Working.Loop-&gt;Exits)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="689"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="690"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// end namespace bfi&#95;detail</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Shared implementation for block frequency analysis.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a shared implementation of BlockFrequencyInfo and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MachineBlockFrequencyInfo, and calculates the relative frequencies of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><Highlight kind="comment">/// blocks.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><Highlight kind="comment">/// LoopInfo defines a loop as a &quot;non-trivial&quot; SCC dominated by a single block,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which is called the header.  A given loop, L, can have sub-loops, which are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loops within the subgraph of L that exclude its header.  (A &quot;trivial&quot; SCC</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><Highlight kind="comment">/// consists of a single block that does not have a self-edge.)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In addition to loops, this algorithm has limited support for irreducible</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SCCs, which are SCCs with multiple entry blocks.  Irreducible SCCs are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><Highlight kind="comment">/// discovered on the fly, and modelled as loops with multiple headers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The headers of irreducible sub-SCCs consist of its entry blocks and all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><Highlight kind="comment">/// nodes that are targets of a backedge within it (excluding backedges within</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><Highlight kind="comment">/// true sub-loops).  Block frequency calculations act as if a block is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><Highlight kind="comment">/// inserted that intercepts all the edges to the headers.  All backedges and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><Highlight kind="comment">/// entries point to this block.  Its successors are the headers, which split</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the frequency evenly.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This algorithm leverages BlockMass and ScaledNumber to maintain precision,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><Highlight kind="comment">/// separates mass distribution from loop scaling, and dithers to eliminate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><Highlight kind="comment">/// probability mass loss.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The implementation is split between BlockFrequencyInfoImpl, which knows the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><Highlight kind="comment">/// type of graph being modelled (BasicBlock vs. MachineBasicBlock), and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase, which doesn&#39;t.  The base class uses \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BlockNode, a wrapper around a uint32&#95;t.  BlockNode is numbered from 0 in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><Highlight kind="comment">/// reverse-post order.  This gives two advantages:  it&#39;s easy to compare the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="comment">/// relative ordering of two nodes, and maps keyed on BlockT can be represented</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><Highlight kind="comment">/// by vectors.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This algorithm is O(V+E), unless there is irreducible control flow, in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which case it&#39;s O(V&#42;E) in the worst case.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><Highlight kind="comment">/// These are the main stages:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><Highlight kind="comment">///  0 Reverse post-order traversal (\\a initializeRPOT()).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Run a single post-order traversal and save it (in reverse) in RPOT.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><Highlight kind="comment">///     All other stages make use of this ordering.  Save a lookup from BlockT</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="735"><Highlight kind="comment">///     to BlockNode (the index into RPOT) in Nodes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><Highlight kind="comment">///  1 Loop initialization (\\a initializeLoops()).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Translate LoopInfo/MachineLoopInfo into a form suitable for the rest of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><Highlight kind="comment">///     the algorithm.  In particular, store the immediate members of each loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><Highlight kind="comment">///     in reverse post-order.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="742"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="743"><Highlight kind="comment">///  2 Calculate mass and scale in loops (\\a computeMassInLoops()).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="744"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="745"><Highlight kind="comment">///     For each loop (bottom-up), distribute mass through the DAG resulting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><Highlight kind="comment">///     from ignoring backedges and treating sub-loops as a single pseudo-node.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Track the backedge mass distributed to the loop header, and use it to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><Highlight kind="comment">///     calculate the loop scale (number of loop iterations).  Immediate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><Highlight kind="comment">///     members that represent sub-loops will already have been visited and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750"><Highlight kind="comment">///     packaged into a pseudo-node.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Distributing mass in a loop is a reverse-post-order traversal through</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><Highlight kind="comment">///     the loop.  Start by assigning full mass to the Loop header.  For each</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><Highlight kind="comment">///     node in the loop:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><Highlight kind="comment">///         - Fetch and categorize the weight distribution for its successors.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><Highlight kind="comment">///           If this is a packaged-subloop, the weight distribution is stored</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><Highlight kind="comment">///           in \\a LoopData::Exits.  Otherwise, fetch it from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><Highlight kind="comment">///           BranchProbabilityInfo.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><Highlight kind="comment">///         - Each successor is categorized as \\a Weight::Local, a local edge</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><Highlight kind="comment">///           within the current loop, \\a Weight::Backedge, a backedge to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><Highlight kind="comment">///           loop header, or \\a Weight::Exit, any successor outside the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="comment">///           The weight, the successor, and its category are stored in \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="comment">///           Distribution.  There can be multiple edges to each successor.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><Highlight kind="comment">///         - If there&#39;s a backedge to a non-header, there&#39;s an irreducible SCC.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><Highlight kind="comment">///           The usual flow is temporarily aborted.  \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><Highlight kind="comment">///           computeIrreducibleMass() finds the irreducible SCCs within the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><Highlight kind="comment">///           loop, packages them up, and restarts the flow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><Highlight kind="comment">///         - Normalize the distribution:  scale weights down so that their sum</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><Highlight kind="comment">///           is 32-bits, and coalesce multiple edges to the same node.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><Highlight kind="comment">///         - Distribute the mass accordingly, dithering to minimize mass loss,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><Highlight kind="comment">///           as described in \\a distributeMass().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><Highlight kind="comment">///     In the case of irreducible loops, instead of a single loop header,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><Highlight kind="comment">///     there will be several. The computation of backedge masses is similar</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"><Highlight kind="comment">///     but instead of having a single backedge mass, there will be one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><Highlight kind="comment">///     backedge per loop header. In these cases, each backedge will carry</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><Highlight kind="comment">///     a mass proportional to the edge weights along the corresponding</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><Highlight kind="comment">///     path.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="comment">///     At the end of propagation, the full mass assigned to the loop will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><Highlight kind="comment">///     distributed among the loop headers proportionally according to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><Highlight kind="comment">///     mass flowing through their backedges.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Finally, calculate the loop scale from the accumulated backedge mass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><Highlight kind="comment">///  3 Distribute mass in the function (\\a computeMassInFunction()).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Finally, distribute mass through the DAG resulting from packaging all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><Highlight kind="comment">///     loops in the function.  This uses the same algorithm as distributing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><Highlight kind="comment">///     mass in a loop, except that there are no exit or backedge edges.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="comment">///  4 Unpackage loops (\\a unwrapLoops()).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Initialize each block&#39;s frequency to a floating point representation of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><Highlight kind="comment">///     its mass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Visit loops top-down, scaling the frequencies of its immediate members</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><Highlight kind="comment">///     by the loop&#39;s pseudo-node&#39;s frequency.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="comment">///  5 Convert frequencies to a 64-bit range (\\a finalizeMetrics()).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Using the min and max frequencies as a guide, translate floating point</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><Highlight kind="comment">///     frequencies to an appropriate range in uint64&#95;t.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It has some known flaws.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - The model of irreducible control flow is a rough approximation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Modelling irreducible control flow exactly involves setting up and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="comment">///     solving a group of infinite geometric series.  Such precision is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="comment">///     unlikely to be worthwhile, since most of our algorithms give up on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="comment">///     irreducible control flow anyway.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Nevertheless, we might find that we need to get closer.  Here&#39;s a sort</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="comment">///     of TODO list for the model with diminishing returns, to be completed as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="comment">///     necessary.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="comment">///       - The headers for the \\a LoopData representing an irreducible SCC</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="comment">///         include non-entry blocks.  When these extra blocks exist, they</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="comment">///         indicate a self-contained irreducible sub-SCC.  We could treat them</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="comment">///         as sub-loops, rather than arbitrarily shoving the problematic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="comment">///         blocks into the headers of the main irreducible SCC.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="comment">///       - Entry frequencies are assumed to be evenly split between the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="comment">///         headers of a given irreducible SCC, which is the only option if we</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="comment">///         need to compute mass in the SCC before its parent loop.  Instead,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="comment">///         we could partially compute mass in the parent loop, and stop when</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="comment">///         we get to the SCC.  Here, we have the correct ratio of entry</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><Highlight kind="comment">///         masses, which we can use to adjust their relative frequencies.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="comment">///         Compute mass in the SCC, and then continue propagation in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><Highlight kind="comment">///         parent.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="comment">///       - We can propagate mass iteratively through the SCC, for some fixed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="comment">///         number of iterations.  Each iteration starts by assigning the entry</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><Highlight kind="comment">///         blocks their backedge mass from the prior iteration.  The final</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841"><Highlight kind="comment">///         mass for each block (and each exit, and the total backedge mass</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><Highlight kind="comment">///         used for computing loop scale) is the sum of all iterations.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><Highlight kind="comment">///         (Running this until fixed point would &quot;solve&quot; the geometric</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><Highlight kind="comment">///         series by simulation.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BT&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl/#ac61cd6020768ae1e60dc3040ce5fbd8d">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl</a> : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase">BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is part of a workaround for a GCC 4.7 crash on lambdas.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">friend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/blockedgesadder">bfi&#95;detail::BlockEdgesAdder</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/bittracker-cpp/#ae3e523a6a11b1e24604b40363978a62a">BT</a>&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Build up \\a Loops using \\a LoopInfo.  \\a LoopInfo gives us a mapping from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// each block to the deepest loop it&#39;s in, but we need the inverse.  For each</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loop, we store in reverse post-order its &quot;immediate&quot; members, defined as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="897"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the header, the headers of immediate sub-loops, and all other blocks in</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Compute mass in (and package up) irreducible SCCs.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre \\c Insert points at the last loop successfully processed by \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> computeIrreducibleMass(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/loopdata">LoopData</a> &#42;OuterLoop,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Compute mass in all loops.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For each loop bottom-up, call \\a computeMassInLoop().</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\post \\a tryToComputeMassInFunction() has returned \\c true.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="961"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> computeMassInFunction();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="962"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="963"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::string <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineblockplacement-cpp/#a8f9ee7f9ffc036496a8663335da175fa">getBlockName</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/blocknode">BlockNode</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const override </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="964"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/bfi-detail/#a01e9ac225b83bb4ded4adbba7d360cbe">bfi&#95;detail::getBlockName</a>(getBlock(<a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="965"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="966"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="967"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The current implementation for computing relative block frequencies does</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="968"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// not handle correctly control-flow graphs containing irreducible loops. To</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="969"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// resolve the problem, we apply a post-processing step, which iteratively</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="970"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// updates block frequencies based on the frequencies of their predesessors.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="971"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This corresponds to finding the stationary point of the Markov chain by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="972"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// an iterative method aka &quot;PageRank computation&quot;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="973"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The algorithm takes at most O(|E| &#42; IterativeBFIMaxIterations) steps but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="974"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// typically converges faster.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="975"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="976"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Decide whether we want to apply iterative inference for a given function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="977"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> needIterativeInference() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="978"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="979"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Apply an iterative post-processing to infer correct counts for irr loops.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="980"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> applyIterativeInference();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="981"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="982"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">ProbMatrixType = std::vector&lt;std::vector&lt;std::pair&lt;size&#95;t, Scaled64&gt;&gt;&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="983"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="984"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Run iterative inference for a probability matrix and initial frequencies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="985"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> iterativeInference(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ProbMatrixType &amp;ProbMatrix,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="986"><Highlight kind="normal">                          std::vector&lt;Scaled64&gt; &amp;Freq) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="987"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="988"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Find all blocks to apply inference on, that is, reachable from the entry</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="989"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and backward reachable from exists along edges with positive probability.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00990" /><CodeLine lineNumber="990"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> findReachableBlocks(std::vector&lt;const BlockT &#42;&gt; &amp;Blocks) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="991"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00992" /><CodeLine lineNumber="992"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Build a matrix of probabilities with transitions (edges) between the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00993" /><CodeLine lineNumber="993"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// blocks: ProbMatrix&#91;I&#93; holds pairs (J, P), where Pr&#91;J -&gt; I | J&#93; = P</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="994"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> initTransitionProbabilities(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00995" /><CodeLine lineNumber="995"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::vector&lt;const BlockT &#42;&gt; &amp;Blocks,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="996"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;const BlockT &#42;, size&#95;t&gt;</a> &amp;BlockIndex,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="997"><Highlight kind="normal">      ProbMatrixType &amp;ProbMatrix) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00998" /><CodeLine lineNumber="998"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00999" /><CodeLine lineNumber="999"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01000" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1000"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Compute the discrepancy between current block frequencies and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1001"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// probability matrix.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1002"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/#a5514a17c0ec3ccae841930a4f8f74f99">Scaled64</a> discrepancy(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ProbMatrixType &amp;ProbMatrix,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Print the frequencies for the current function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Prints the frequencies for the blocks in the current function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Blocks are printed in the natural iteration order of the function, rather</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// than reverse post-order.  This provides two advantages:  writing -analyze</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// tests is easier (since blocks come out in source order), and even</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// unreachable blocks are printed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\a BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase::print() only knows reverse post-order, so</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// we need to override it here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl/#ad05ed8871c23e9c87114b754bc6098ab"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl/#ad05ed8871c23e9c87114b754bc6098ab">print</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/#a0b3608d47dacd2c63e831fee11073c2c">BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase::dump</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1273"><Highlight kind="normal">                        &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot; has irr loop header weight &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; &#42;HeaderWeight</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1276"><Highlight kind="normal">      uint64&#95;t HeaderWeightValue = &#42;HeaderWeight;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1282"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1283"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As a heuristic, if some headers don&#39;t have a weight, give them the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1284"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// minimum weight seen (not to disrupt the existing trends too much by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1285"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// using a weight that&#39;s in the general range of the other headers&#39; weights,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1286"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and the minimum seems to perform better than the average.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1287"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: better update in the passes that drop the header weight.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1288"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If no headers have a weight, give them even weight (use weight 1).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1289"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!MinHeaderWeight)</Highlight></CodeLine>
